title: Problem 2150_B
statement: ParagonX9 - HyperioxX⠀Alice has a grid of size n × n. Initially, all cells are colored white. Alice wants to color some cells black satisfying certain properties.Let (x_1, y_1), (x_2, y_2), ..., (x_m, y_m) be the cells colored black. You are given an array a of size n. The following conditions must be satisfied: For each row k (1 ≤ k ≤ n), there exists exactly a_k indices i (1 ≤ i ≤ m) such that x_i = k. Less formally, there should be a_k black cells in row k.
